metadata.Title: CVE-2019-9433 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - low.
metadata.Description:
In libvpx, there is a possible information disclosure due to improper input validation. This could lead to remote information disclosure with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is needed for exploitation. Product: AndroidVersions: Android-10Android ID: A-80479354

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-9433` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libvpx6 - 1.8.1-2
vpx-tools - 1.8.1-2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libvpx package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.8.1-2').
